skill.name: wrangler
skill.description: Deploy and manage Cloudflare Workers, Pages, KV, R2, D1, and other Cloudflare services using the `wrangler` CLI.
skill.summary: Deploy and manage Cloudflare Workers, Pages, KV, R2, D1, and other Cloudflare services using the `wr...
skill.author: Dicklesworthstone

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation in SKILL.md. No executable code, scripts, network operations, file system access, or environment variable reads were detected. Pure prompt-based skill with zero attack surface.

content.user_title: Deploy Cloudflare Workers with Wrangler CLI
content.value_statement: Managing Cloudflare Workers and related services requires learning multiple CLI commands. This skill provides ready-to-use commands for deploying Workers, managing KV storage, R2 buckets, D1 databases, and Pages projects.
actual_capabilities: List and manage KV namespaces and keys
Manage R2 object storage buckets and objects
Execute SQL queries on D1 databases
Deploy static sites to Cloudflare Pages
limitations: Requires wrangler CLI to be installed on the system
Requires valid Cloudflare authentication before use
Does not create or configure Cloudflare resources automatically
Commands require proper permissions and configured wrangler.toml

use_cases.title: Deploy Workers to Production
use_cases.description: Deploy serverless functions to Cloudflare's global network with a single command.

use_cases.title: Manage Cloud Infrastructure
use_cases.description: Handle KV namespaces, R2 storage, and D1 databases through CLI commands.

use_cases.title: Publish Static Sites
use_cases.description: Deploy static websites and applications to Cloudflare Pages from any directory.

prompt_templates.title: List Deployed Workers
prompt_templates.prompt: List all deployed Cloudflare Workers using wrangler

prompt_templates.title: Deploy Worker
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my Cloudflare Worker to production

prompt_templates.title: Query D1 Database
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute a SQL query on my D1 database to fetch user records

prompt_templates.title: Upload to R2
prompt_templates.prompt: Upload a file to my R2 bucket using wrangler

output_examples.input: Deploy my Cloudflare Worker to production

best_practices: Run 'wrangler login' first to authenticate with Cloudflare
Use 'wrangler whoami' to verify authentication status
Test workers locally with 'wrangler dev' before deployment
anti_patterns: Hardcoding secrets in wrangler.toml instead of using secret command
Skipping migrations when updating D1 database schemas
Not specifying namespace-id when managing KV keys

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The wrangler CLI must be installed separately.

faq.question: What are the usage limits for Cloudflare Workers?
faq.answer: Free tier includes 100,000 requests per day. Paid plans offer higher limits. Check Cloudflare docs for current limits.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes. Use wrangler deploy in scripts with CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN environment variable for automated deployments.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only runs read-only wrangler commands. Your code and data stay on your machine. Authentication uses OAuth.

faq.question: Why is my deployment failing?
faq.answer: Common issues: not logged in (run wrangler login), missing wrangler.toml, syntax errors in worker code, or exceeded limits.

faq.question: How does this compare to Vercel or Netlify?
faq.answer: Cloudflare Workers offers global edge deployment with no cold starts. Pricing is based on requests and CPU time, not instance hours.
